windows.symptom: Surface RT will not update - error 8007000e windows update ran into a problem        I've tried every solution I can find, nothing works. I've even completely reset it. The only thing in Window Update history after the reset is: kb2883295.Other then not updating it works fine.There are about 50 items in the SoftwareDistribution/Download folder after an attemptedI did delete all files in SoftwareDistribution, reran update - no luckI did rename the SoftwareDistribution folder, reran update - no luckTried all the troubleshooter files in different KBsI'd offer more information but have none!!Any hints what to do next would be appreciated. I just reset it again so it's a blank page.Thank you for your time!

Unable to not only change where new content is saved, but also can't install NVIDIA Control Panel due to error 0x80070005 showing on both        Hi,So let me explain my situation:I recently had problems with mic issues, (turns out I was missing Maxx audio something) and to fix it I reset my PC. Before I did this, I was able to change the install location of apps on Microsoft store and have NVIDIA Control Panel. Although I fixed the mic issues I had, now I can't change the install location nor download NVIDIA Control Panel. Might I add, I kinda need NVIDIA Control Panel in order for GeForce Experience to work. I've been at this for a week now, and I have tried many methods, such as Change permissions on files (When changing on C drive, access is denied), take control over command prompt, and even adding a take ownership command on Registry Editor. I just want my computer to work, and I'm sick and tired of being forced to install apps on a drive that literally has no space for more. I have a Dell G7 7588, and if needed I will provide more information
solutions: Can you tell me how do you fix your Maxx Audio issue? Simply via resetting your PC or did anything else?

Hi Noah. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.It sounds like there are drive anomalies not resolved by the Reset which might be if you do a true Clean Install by wiping the drive to reset the partition table. This is what makes an install Clean and a Reset doesn't do this, it leaves the same partition structure in place. So you would follow the illustrated steps in this link which compile the best possible Clean Install of Windows which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... The reason I suggest this is that no one who has adopted the install in the above link has ever come back to report further problems I've seen, including another version failure. This is because everything in Windows 10 is dependent upon the quality of the install, especially Version Updates which will choke on lesser quality installs. Whether we like it or not, this is where we are in Windows 10.Be sure to unplug all other drives during the install so they cannot interfere, after install they will be freshly linked with default permissions so that they aren't withheld as Default Save Location due to permission anomalies or corruptions.To create bootable Windows 10 Installation Media (on another PC if necessary) install Media Creation Tool and follow the directions in the middle of the download page here:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Insert media, boot it by powering up PC while pressing the BIOS Boot Menu Key for your PC maker given in this chart:https://www.sysnative.com/forums/hardware-tutor... If the media won't boot you may need to enter BIOS/UEFI Setup (pressing key given in chart in link above) to turn off Fast Boot or Fast Startup first.Choose the boot device as a UEFI device if offered, then on second screen choose Install Now, then Custom Install, then at the drive selection screen delete all partitions down to Unallocated Space to get it cleanest, select the Unallocated Space, click Next to let it create and format the needed partitions and start install - this makes it foolproof.You will get and keep the best possible install to the exact extent you stick with the steps, tools and methods in the linked tutorial. It's a better install than any amount of money could buy and a great learning experience that will make you the master of your PC because you will learn everything that works best and how to apply it with your own hands.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

Noah, you will reinstall Windows doing one of life's greatest learning experiences. Read the tutorial to see if it's something you want to try. I will be here to guide you.
ok I get how to clean install.... but how do I wipe the Drive itself?

Noah, it's in the Clean Install tutorial and also the steps I wrote out for you above. During Custom Install, at the drive selection screen choose each partition and Delete until there is only Unallocated Space, then choose the space and click Next to auto-format the needed partitions and begin - this makes it foolproof. Be SURE to follow the steps to back up and prepare, and also the setup steps. Drivers are important enough they are printed in red. If you follow all steps you will have no problems.Clean Install tutorial: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki...Keep asking back any questions. I will be here to help until this case is resolved.

windows.symptom: open epub files        how to change the default for file type epub from notepad to Microsoft edge
solutions: Go Settings, Apps, Default apps, at the bottom;

Hi Hema Open the Settings App (gear icon on your Start Menu) Go to Apps - Default Apps At the bottom of that page, click 'Set Defaults by File Type' In the resulting list, scroll down to find the .Epub file type, then set that to the Edge Browser . . .Please Note: in a recent Windows 10 update Microsoft removed support for Epub files in the Edge Browser, so it may be best to download a free Epub reader form the Microsoft Storehttps://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/freda-epub-eb...

windows.symptom: Device not being detected?        I recently bought a new headset with a mic. The headset has a 3.5mm jack and a usb connector powering a mic. The problem is windows 10 not detecting anything when I plug in the usb, and the mic isn't registered as a device at all. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling Realtek Audio drivers, restarted my computer, updated windows 10, but to no avail. I'm not sure what to do, Why is it not showing up in my devices? Notes:-the Headset is the runmus K8 gaming headset-
solutions: Have you checked Device Manager to see if the proper drivers are installed?

windows.symptom: Windows 10 1909 update        How long should the Windows 10 1909 update take to install?At 12 AM last night I started the update process. It is now 11:25 AM and the update process is only at 27%.I did a hard power down and powered it back up. all changes were undone properly and the computer is back to normal.How can I get the update to install?
solutions: Hello Jmcinvale, thank you for providing this question. I am a seasoned Windows expert with almost a decade in usage and support experience and hope to resolve your problems quickly.Usually a simple update should be a matter of minutes, though multiple updates or milestone updates can take significantly longer up to a couple of hours. A full day is way too long and resetting it was likely the right choice.You can just try starting the update anew or if you like try to clean the update cache beforehand.Open the Services Window and stop the Windows Update Service and then move all content under C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution to a new folder called backup1.Then start the service again and try anew. If the problem reoccurs we need to look closer at what happened with the update failure.If you consider your problem solved it would be very good if you marked the answer which helped you so others can find and use this thread.If this didn't solve your problem or you need further assistance please answer in this thread and i would be happy to help.kind regards F. Grobusch

Correction.It was the 1809 update.I have a habit of delaying updates as long as possible and that saved me here as I found the 1809 update when first released could delete users files and was promptly pulled until fixed.My laptop is already 1809 and I lost nothing so it must be fixed.I am updating it to 1909.Given I just installed 1809 on my desktop how do I get it to update to 1909 as the update isn't showing yet?
Check the update settings and turn off the delay then search again. Or get the update assistant here:support.microsoft.com/help/4028685/windows-10-get-the-update
Will do thanks.

Just tried to update to 1909 and get the following errorA problem has been detected and Windows has been shut down to prevent damageto your computer.The problem seems to be caused by the following file: ntoskrnl.exeIRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUALIf this is the first time you've seen this stop error screen,restart your computer. If this screen appears again, followthese steps:Check to make sure any new hardware or software is properly installed.If this is a new installation, ask your hardware or software manufacturerfor any Windows updates you might need.If problems continue, disable or remove any newly installed hardwareor software. Disable BIOS memory options such as caching or shadowing.If you need to use safe mode to remove or disable components, restartyour computer, press F8 to select Advanced Startup Options, and thenselect Safe Mode.Technical Information:*** STOP: 0x0000000a (0x0000000000000008, 0x0000000000000002, 0x0000000000000000, 0xfffff8020939c6d4)*** ntoskrnl.exe - Address 0xfffff8020945a980 base at 0xfffff802092a4000 DateStamp 0xdf79e7cb

My name is Riccardo and I would be happy to assist today with this issue. There are a few things we can do to fix this issue for you... Step 1: Checking Integrity of File System / Updates Go to Start > type in cmd > right-click Command Prompt and run as administrator. Type in the following: sfc /scannow Let the above process run and complete. After that is done, type in the following: dism /online /cleanup-image /restorehealth Let the above process run and then restart your computer. Once logged into Windows 10, go to Start > type in: Check for UpdatesClick the Check for Updates icon Click the Check for Updates button Are you able to get the new Feature Build? Step 2: Do a Repair Upgrade If after doing all of the above, it is still not functioning properly, do a Windows 10 Repair Upgrade. Although your files should stay intact; we always suggest backing them up as a precaution.https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...Let me know if this works for you as I will be here to assist with any further issues.

On my desktop I finally got it to update by using the update assistant from Microsoft. it's doing the update now.On my laptop, I had to uninstall the latest quality update before it would install 1909.My third desktop updated without a problem.
Great let us know if you need anything else. Glad it worked out for you!
Will do thanks.

windows.symptom: eSIM        will upgrading to windows 10 pro give me an eSIM option? i currently dont have that on this laptop
solutions: Hi Jamin Updating to Windows 10 Pro is not necessary, the Home version supports eSIM Open Device Manager (accessible by right clicking your Start Button) Expand the Network Adapters section Do you see a WWAN card listed in that section? Can I presume you have a SIM card slot on your laptop? If so, for that to work, you must also have a WWAN card installed on your laptop A lot of laptops will have a SIM card slot, however the WWAN card would have been an optional extra when the laptop was purchased, did you purchase that laptop from new and if so, did you opt for the Cellular connection option?

windows.symptom: Error 1801        I am trying to use Vevor cutter plotter model number KI-720 on my HP Envy 360 Laptop via direct USB. I have installed the most recent version of SignMaster software, as well as the driver software for the vinyl spinner. I was able to utilize the cutter for 30 minutes before receiving error code 1801 (0x00000709) stating that I should "Check the printer name and make sure that the printer is connected to the network". I have reached out to the vevor support team and they informed me that this was an error resulting from Windows and it is out of their control. Please help!

Computer performing way below expectations all of a sudden        Hello, My computer is performing way below expectations as of recently.I have done almost everything from a system restore, chkdsk, /scannow, scanned for malware with my premium malware bytes, and still no solution to be found.Running tests saying that my CPU has high back ground usage but task manager has nothing running in the background.Computer is laggy, choppy, and the processing times for each program has tremendously decreased.Any help is appreciatedComputer Specs:Windows 10 "Pro"i7-4790kASUS Sabertooth Z97 Mark SNvidia Geforce GTX 980HyperX 16GB RAM
solutions: Temperatures for all hardware (CPU) are all in great standing as well. Everything in Disk Management is showing health (C:, Disk 0 partition 2, Disk 0 Partition 5, New volume (D:), and Recovery.

windows.symptom: Out of Range error        I recently installed Windows 10 to my computer previously running beautifully on Windows 7, since Microsoft support for Windows 7 is ending. My ASUS monitor is showing "Out of Range." I've started in safe mode numerous times, changed the display resolution, and attempted to install both the video card and monitor drivers (install always fails). Any help would be much appreciated.
solutions: Hi mugwumpAZ Resolution is only half of the settings, the refresh rate may also be putting the monitor out of range . . .With regards to monitor drivers, I would not worry too much about those, for the moment, just use a default Microsoft monitor driver with the correct resolution and refresh rate . . .Go to the Asus website and get the exact resolution and refresh rate of that monitorThen go into the Video card settings and also the Monitor settings and make sure you have matched the expected resolution (for example 1920 X 1080) and refresh rate (for example 60Hz)Then restart your PC . . .

windows.symptom: Mp4 file in wordpress does not work on edge, but is working on chrome, safari, mozilla        Hello,I would like to know why a mp4 presentation on my website can not run on edge browsers and runs with no problem in other browsers. I have checked the setting and looks everything ok, even I have tried in different pc's but the problem persist. Please help me since I would like to get exposure in all browsers.this is my websitehttp://handcraftcorps.comThank you!~
solutions: Hi Desktop11 Is that the intro video (videito2comp.mp4) on the home page that is not playing on Edge, I cannot also get that to play in Edge . . .You may check the encoding format of that video, that may be the cause . . . The Edge Browser likes MP4 files with H264 codec (maximum 720p of resolution) with AC3 audio on itOtherwise, when using video like that on a web page, it is normal to provide the video in 3 or 4 formats and include that as an option in the HTML tags, so the browser can pick the version it cam playThe best format for video on your website would be WebM (VP8) I generally encode the video into a few formats and then add a tag like this and let the browser choose the most compatible format<video width="320" height="240" controls> <source src="ideito2comp.webm" type="video/webm"> <source src="ideito2comp.mp4" type="video/mp4"> <source src="ideito2comp.ogg" type="video/ogg"> Your browser does not support the video tag. </video>

Do I need to replace windows 7?        I am currently running windows 10 over windows 7. Windows 7 was an OEM install. Will in need to purchase a new version of windows 10 for the basic operating system?
solutions: I am currently running windows 10 over windows 7. Windows 7 was an OEM install. Will in need to purchase a new version of windows 10 for the basic operating system?Your question is confusing.You have already replaced Windows 7?@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@You may or may not still get 10 for free.The free upgrade to Windows 10 offer from Microsoft expired on the 29th July, 2016.You will have to contact MS support and they may be able to assist you with a free upgrade to 10..Also read this information:All the Ways You Can Still Upgrade to Windows 10 for FreeHere's how you can still get a free Windows 10 upgrade | ZDNet@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

windows.symptom: Webcam hardware is not connected to computer        my laptop came with a built-in webcam.  I have not been able to use it for a few years.  This is what I am finding.  How do I correct this?
solutions: Have you checked your BIOS to see if it is turned on?

Hi Lisa, This error occurs if a device that was previously connected to the computer is no longer connected. To resolve this problem, reconnect this hardware device to the computer. No resolution is necessary. This error code is only used to indicate the disconnected status of the device and does not require you to resolve it. The error code resolves automatically when you connect the associated device to the computer, says Microsoft.For additional information, please refer to this link: https://www.thewindowsclub.com/hardware-device-...Disclaimer: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information that might solve your current issue.Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products).Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.Let us know if this helped you out. Your feedback is much appreciated. Thanks and regards,

solutions: That's a question for Amazon:https://www.amazon.com/ask/questions/Tx16JNK4TZCA4WM/1

windows.symptom: Kernel Power - Event ID 41 - Task Category 63 [Unexpected Shut Downs and Reboots] Windows 10 64 version 1909 build 18363.818        My computer keeps randomly rebooting and shutting down. I looked into my system logs and this is what it says. How do I fix this and stop unexpected reboots and shut downs?. This continues even with a completely new install. I have all up to date drivers and memory tests preformed, GPU stress tested, CPU tested. has been doing since for a few weeks after Window updates. Should I downgrade to 1703 as suggested in the past within this forum from Andre Da Costa MVP Volunteer Moderator, April 16th, 2018? thanks for any info
solutions: Hi, Kernel-Power 41 (63) error mostly means the problem with power supply unit. Can you replace it for checking?Or carefully look at motherboard and PSU for leaked or swelled up capacitors (little barrels).And you can try to update BIOS and turn off all CPU power saving (C-states) in BIOS

windows.symptom: isp        Why does my computer think I'm in a different city than where I actually live?this question was posted many moons ago.I would like to know  has anyone ever had their locations changed to the right city?and if so how was it done?
solutions: Unless your computer has a built-in GPS device (as mobile phones do) Windows has to take a guess at where you are based on whatever information is available. Sometimes those guesses are hilarious. You should feel glad that Windows only had your city wrong - I've read posts from people who were pegged in the wrong country altogether.There is a place in Start > Settings > Privacy > Location where you can specify a default location, but that only applies for apps from Microsoft Store.If Windows locates you on a different planet - that's something that might worry me.

windows.symptom: windows mail app keeps uninstalling itself        I have MS Outlook installed, which I use for work email but I wanted to use the windows mail app for personal email, which was not installed.I went to the MS app store, installed the Mail App and configured my personal email and thought everything was well.   Then when I restarted my computer the next day the Mail App had disappeared.    Thinking it was some fluke, I reinstalled it from the app store again and reconfigured my personal email. Then today, it's gone again.   Do you guys know what keeps removing the Mail app from my computer?
solutions: Hi, BearFlag My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Follow these steps to repair the Microsoft Store and Apps: 1) launch powershell 2) Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted You have to select (Yes to All) 3) Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml"}Restart your system Check the link to better understand how to execute the commands: https://www.digitalcitizen.life/how-reinstall-a...You can also download this application to try to repair the Microsoft Store. http://aka.ms/diag_apps10You can also reset the Microsoft Store https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/15057-clear...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

That didn't help.   I had to reinstall it again.   There's nothing wrong with the MS Store.   The other apps I download from there don't get removed.   Just the Mail App.Does it have anything to do with the fact that I have Outlook installed?

I don `t believe Follow these steps: Press the Start key and type the word CMD or Powershell, right click on the command prompt and select Run as administrator, enter the following commands one by one followed by the Enter key:•- DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Scanhealth •- DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth •- DISM.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup •- sfc /scannow https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/929833...

I honestly think there's some kind of program loaded onto my laptop that removes it.   I did the scan health and nothing was found.I reinstalled the Mail App and restarted my computer.    It was there but after 10min it disappeared.    Is there any way to know what program might be installed on my laptop that can uninstall certain apps?

I recommend that you repair Windows completely before you must make a backup of your personal files, third-party software will be removed. Here the link to download the Windows ISO.https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-downlo...https://www.kapilarya.com/how-to-repair-windows...https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/16397-repai...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

You're not alone. I believe that this is a glitch with the recent v1909 update. Windows Store apps will randomly uninstall themselves with no explained reason. Trigger is to simply sign out, reboot, or put machine to sleep for over an hour. Reinstalling the apps are useless as they will simply uninstall them again.Even pinning Store apps to the taskbar will not prevent these apps from randomly getting uninstalled.I'm an IT Pro and consider myself to be extremely technically competent and I'm fully blaming Windows on this one. I've seen my fair share of problems caused by Windows updates. Running an SFC scan or performing any other recommended repairs to the OS is useless. It's an annoying, but minor bug. I'd wait until Microsoft gets more and more users to report this issue via their Feedback app so it pops up in their radar for them to fix in a future update.

windows.symptom: windows 10 update and my mail icon disappeared        My computer recently updated and my mail icon has disappeared along with the Microsoft store icon on the taskbar. what the hell happened and how do I get them back?Thanks
solutions: Hi,We need to clarify a few information first for us to better understand your taskbar apps concern. Please answer the following:Are Mail and Microsoft Store the only ones that disappeared on the task bar?Can you still access the Start Menu? If so, can open Mail or Microsoft Store through the Start Menu?If you still have applications left on the taskbar, can you still open or access those apps?If you can access these two applications in the Start  Menu, you can pin them back to the taskbar by following these steps:Right-click the application.Hover your mouse on More.Click Pin to taskbar.We hope to hear from you soon.

Mail icon, is gone from the start menu. But the microsoft store icon is gone on the task bar but if you click on where it was, the microsoft store opens and my garmin express icon has been replace by a document page but will open garmin express. so in order for me to access my email, i had to open up outlook and pin it on my browser bar.

There is a possibility that your current user profile is having an issue. This can be the reason why you're not able to access the Mail app through the Start Menu, why the icon of the Garmin app became a document, and why the Microsoft Store icon is missing on the taskbar. We recommend creating a new administrator account to see if all of your apps are there and to verify if you can access them.Let us know the outcome.
my mail icon disappeared from the task bar
No icon in start meny and when I search for program with free text it doesnt appear. When Im trying to install again. It refuses and says app is already installed.
please display gmail and facebook on my screen
did you ever figure out how t find the mail icon in Windows 10?
Nope, using web interfaceinstead.
